oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup - 1948-04-07 - KOMA
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program on April 7, 1948 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla). Staff includes Perry Ward (master of ceremonies), Allan Page (announcer, director), and Kenyon Brown (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chuck Davis; Roundup Boys; Thomas Trio; Cowboy Jess; Lexie Lou and Ray; Lem Hawkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Opening statements and theme / (1:11) Perry Ward introduces Chuck Davis and the Roundup Boys / (1:10) Chuck Davis and the Roundup Boys performed an instrumental fiddle tune / (3:00) Perry Ward introduces the Thomas Trio and tells a joke / (3:50) The Thomas Trio performs "Sioux City Sue" / (5:45) Perry Ward introduces the next song / (5:56) Cowboy Jess performs "Hold That Critter Down" / (8:13) Chuck Davis performs "Under The Double Eagle" / (9:40) Lexie Lou and Ray perform "Echoes From The Hills" / (11:39) Perry Ward introduces Lem Hawkins / (12:10) Lem Hawkins performs "On A Cold Winter’s Night" / (13:45) CBS and Oklahoma Roundup announcement
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); CBS Inc.; Davis, Chuck; Ward, Perry, 1914-1989;
